page.title: 06CANCER RESEACH
page.content: CLARE HALL WAS AN ISOLATION HOSPITAL FOR SMALLPOX AND TB.IT WAS DECIDED ABOUT SIX YEARS AGO THAT THE HOSPITAL WAS NOT NEEDED ANY MORE AS IT HAD BEEN EMPTY A LONG TIME.THE CANCER RESEARCH FUND BUILT THE LABS HERE BECAUSE THERE WAS ALREADY A HOSPITAL ON THIS SITE.AT THE MOMENT THERE ARE SIXTY_FIVE PEOPLE EMPLOYED THERE.IT WILL BE FULLY OPERATIONAL NEXT YEAR WHEN ONE HUNDRED AND TWENTY TO ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY PEOPLE WILL BE EMPLOYED.THE OLD NURSES HOME IS STILL HERE BUT IT HAS BEEN CHANGED TO MAKE THREE FLATS,THREE BED SITS AND THREE OVER NIGHT ROOMS.THESE ARE FOR PEOPLE WORKING ON THE SITE FROM JAPAN,ITALY AND CANADA.THERE IS A RESTAURANT FOR ABOUT FORTY_FOUR PEOPLE .THE ANIMALS AREA IS STRICTLY CLEANED ,THE CAGES ARE STERILISED IN BIG MACHINES OF WHICH THEY HAVE THREE COSTING HALF A MILLION POUNDS.THEY ARE
